"All right, maybe you don't w=
ant to let me go.  Then, what would you like to do with me? Surely you want=
 me to suffer a fate worse than destruction right?  I know you would."

As - as far as I know, I - I... I - don't think I'm related to him. I deepl=

> His deeply hidden power of his spark recedes and quickly returns him to h=
is regular height. He had no notion of how to control it, nor had he known =
what it was. As it reverses, he suddenly feels a good portion of power leav=
e his body, yet, he was not about to abandon the act of defending himself a=

u've abducted one of my own, and turned him into your evil pawn. No matter =
the consequence, I will stand my ground and do whatever it takes to rightfu=
lly return my leader to his role as the commander of the Autobots. Even if =
I have to saccrifice my own spark to accomplish my mission. That is why I'm=

ow it or not, someone who was once very close to me, needs my help and I ne=

>=
 >

 I will fall many times if I have to. But rest assured Rodimus, when the ti=
me is right, and you finally reach out to me, I promise my hand will be the=
re to reach out to you. And when I do, I won't let go. I promise, I will no=
t abandon you or this cause. As dark as you are now, you may not understand=
, but hopefully one day, you will."

ter all, this is your domain, and I am an intruder here. "

ns were still his enemies. He was however still taken aback by Hydra's ques=

The battle was not what it seemed . . . 
> > > 
> > > The punch Rodimus had=
 thrown, the one that was so easily blocked by Tuscon, would have shocked R=
odimus had it landed. He would have been glad to be rid of this annoyance, =
yes, but it would have been somewhat disappointing as well. 
> > > 
> > > S=
o when Rodimus was spun around by Tuscon, the Autobot may have missed the w=
icked smile on his face, When Tuscon tried to ram Rodimus into a wall, he m=
ay not have noticed that the sound of crunching metal was not Rodimus' but =
the reinrorced wall shearing and tearing under the force of the assault. It=
 was not the sound of Rodimkus' defeat that resonated through the room, but=
 it was something else!
> > > 
> > > Many of the same teachers that had ins=
tructed Tuscon had trained a young Hot Rod as well - Jazz, Prowl, Brawn, Ku=
p, even Optimus himself! And while Rodimus no longer clearly remembered all=
 these ones and what they had meant to him, thier lessons were still ground=
 into him, and his reflexes that had been honed over the years of battle! 
=
> > > 
> > > Also, this was no young Hot Rod that stood there before them, =
but a figure shapped by the energy of the matrix into a character of leader=
ship, power and ability. He no longer had access to the knowledge and wisdo=
m of the matrix, the energy having been stripped from him. But that power t=
hat had been imparted was still there, reconfigured by the power of the pre=
dacon shell program! He was faster, stronger and far more durable then Hot =
Rod ever was, he was DARK RODIMUS!
> > > 
> > > So when Rodimus hit the wal=
l it was not truely pain that he felt, but the elation that a true battle w=
as in the making. He felt that charge that all warriors felt when they face=
d a foe that had some metal! It was an eagerness twisted by Predacon progra=
mming into something dark and loathsome. 
> > > 
> > > So when he stood and=
 turned around it was not defeat in his stance but derision, "So you fancy =
yourself to be a Prime do you, scrappling?" Rodimus said his tone still moc=
king as he raised his arm, smiling as his optics glowing with energy, "Well=
 let's see what you got!" With a thought he fired a blast of plasma energy =
from his arm mounted cannon at this new incarnation of Tuscon, who for the =
moment appeared to be posturing for Hydras!
> > > 
> > > OOC: Remember, the=
 matrix that is housed within Rodimus has no energy of its own, only the ho=
using. It does not have the power to reach out and transform anyone, althou=
gh I do have some ideas. I am not sure if you want to redo your post, or le=
t it go as it stands.
